reviews:
Exactly what you need in an outdoor / work headlamp. Bright enough, light weight enough for camping / backpacking etc. Charge lasts long enough to get you though the night. The red LED light is perfect for maintaining your night vision. Headband is high quality. Easy to use lock out function.

Highly recommend this product. Mine weighed in at 100g

reviews:
I liked this headlight which I use for camping, fishing, hiking, and working on my car. The light output is nice but the turbo mode only lasts 30 seconds and is otherwise only useful for a quick search. The problem I have with this headlight is the battery life. When left on the shelf for only a few days, the battery is already dead from a full charge. I thought maybe it was a fluke but I've recharged it several times and tested the battery life or lack of and it appears to die from a complete charge in less than 3 days. Useless if you expect to use it in an emergency setting and don't always have it being charged [which is probably terrible for the battery anyway].

Overall good lamp but needs to improve its battery system.
product_name: NITECORE NU32 550 Lumen LED Rechargeable Headlamp with White and Red Beams, Black

#104 in Headlamps

review_title: This headlamp checks all the right boxes
reviews:
This is a comfortable & ergonomic headlamp that illuminates farther & brighter than my Surefire 600 lumen flashlights (G2X & 6PX), and also provides an excellent amount of peripheral illumination to see both far & wide.

PROS:
- lightweight & feels balanced - meaning, it's not front-heavy bc of the design
- single button operation is intuitive
- easy to tilt up & down
- durable, sweatproof/waterproof for outdoor activities, including hunting.
- 4 white modes (high, medium, low and SOS) that illuminate far & wide
- 2 red modes (steady red for night hunting & flashing red)
- integrated, rechargeable battery

CONS:
- limited to white or red lights
- no blue or green lights as night vision options

For 100% transparency - I'm neither paid nor endorsed for posting this review. I have no affiliation with this company, and didn't receive anything for free or discounted.

reviews: High mode is only 190 lumens? Really? Turbo brings you up to 550 lumens but only for about 30 seconds before dining back down. I don’t see why they couldn’t include an intermediary brightness at around 300 lumens. Something that wouldn’t overheat the unit but was still a useful brightness for things where 190 just doesn’t cut it. I would gladly take a 300 lumen mode that only lasted 3-4 hours vs the 17 of the weak high mode included.

reviews: Maybe too heavy for small children and the elderly. For everyone else, This is the best headlamp you can buy. Ive owned 7 headlamps from different manufacturers, none of them even come close to nitecore! My wife thinks it’s slightly heavy, but she’s also 90 pounds and very weak. I could wear 3 of them stacked up no problem. Just buy this thing if you’re looking for a quality headlamp.

rank:
#24,420 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)
#104 in Headlamps

reviews:
I did a lot of research and I needed 4 things out of a headlamp.
1- Red and white light.
2- USB rechargeable (Batteries are just extra item that you have to account for)
3- Bright
4- Durable
This product fulfills all of my checkboxes.
They have wide angle which is good for walking around in dark.
I use a hand held flash lamp to pinpoint search, as narrow focused beam is much preferable.
So far these have been through 5 fields. NTC included. And many land navs through thick vegetation.
Only Draw back of this is that, the buttons are very sensitive and I have had them accidentally turned on and lose most of the charge while in my Assault pack or Ruck.
